wpPage.title: Careers
wpPage.content:
For more than three decades, FLS has grown from a niche projects company to a versatile, global organization involved in logistics, warehousing, and trading with more than 300 employees across eleven countries. 

Our passion for supply chain solutions, a dynamic team attitude and individual growth set us apart from others. 

We aim to build on this successful history and are always looking for highly motivated and talented people to join us on our journey of success. 

WORKPLACE & CULTURE

Diversity and Inclusion

At FLS, we want to build a second home where everyone has an equal opportunity to excel and contribute to the success of the company – regardless of disability, race, religious beliefs, cultures, gender, sexual orientations, and perspectives.

As a growing company, we recognise that the diversity of our workforce is an important aspect as we bring talents together; each with their unique background, ability and character. As a team working together and collaborating with internal stakeholders and the external community, we ensure that working environments and conditions in all offices are conducive for every employee to be part of the FLS family.

careers.emptyTextPlaceholder:
Unfortunately, we don’t have any vacancies at the moment.

Don’t worry, email us your CV and a cover letter to people@fls-group.com and we will contact you as soon as new opportunities arise.

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Supervise and manage all aspects of import and export logistics, including documentation, customs clearance, and coordination with carriers and freight forwarders.
  • Manage and maintain major customer relationships, overseeing pricing, invoicing, and ongoing account development to ensure satisfaction and retention.
  • Proactively collaborate with suppliers, carriers, and other stakeholders to streamline processes and identify and resolve the root cause of issues.
  • Ensure invoices are accurate and issued promptly to customers.
  • Mentor and train junior team members.
  • Other tasks as assigned
careerSingle.jobPurposes: As a Senior Operations Coordinator, you will be responsible for the end-to-end lifecycle of key accounts assigned to you. This includes overseeing and optimizing the operations processes to drive process efficiency, better coordination which eventually leads to customer satisfaction. You will impact the business by maintaining strong customer relationships, providing guidance to junior operators, and ensuring seamless management of key accounts from pricing to development. Emphasis is placed on effective communication, strategic planning, and maintaining high standards of service delivery throughout all operational facets.
careerSingle.qualification:
• Minimum five (5) years’ experience in logistics, supply chain or equivalent
  • Proven experience with handling project or out-of-gauge shipments
  • Working experience with Cargowise is preferred
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
  • Adaptability, analytical skills, versatility and ability to work under pressure
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
  • Detail-oriented and capable of problem-solving in a dynamic environment
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
1. Technical Expertise: Proficiency in utilizing Cargowise and OOG Logistics to manage and optimize specialized cargo operations.
  2. Import-Export Logistics: Strong understanding and experience in streamlining import and export logistics processes.
  3. Customer Relationship Management: Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with major customer accounts, ensuring satisfaction and retention.
  4. Account Management: Proven ability to manage key accounts comprehensively, including pricing strategies, invoicing, and developmental initiatives.
  5. Communication Skills: Effective verbal and written communication skills, essential for internal coordination and customer interactions.
  6. Service Excellence: Commitment to maintaining high standards of service delivery and continuous improvement across all operational aspects.
  7. Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of addressing challenges in a dynamic operational environment.
  8. Adaptability: Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and operational demands, ensuring flexibility and efficiency in workflow management.
careerSingle.title: Senior Operations Coordinator

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Prepare and present proposals, contracts, and pricing to potential clients.
• Provide market feedback to the company leadership regarding competitive offerings, and
prospect needs and generate product development ideas.
• Drive increased revenue and profit to achieve the Company’s ambitious growth.
• Develop a pipeline of qualified prospects for targeted solicitation, understand their
business and solutions requirements, and engage in a consultative sale process.
• Actively responsible for P&L and Strategic planning respectively.
• Monitor the progress of claims and customer Satisfaction. Leads to fixing all issues and
increasing the satisfaction level of the customer.
• Comply with FLS corporate Structure, Values, and Integrity.
• Responsible for complying with all relevant laws, regulations, and Company policies.
• Other duties as assigned by management.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
The Business Development Executive is responsible for initiating and developing business
opportunities with new and existing customers. This role involves developing and implementing
strategic plans to expand our company’s presence in the market, building strong relationships with
key stakeholders, and achieving revenue growth targets.
careerSingle.qualification:
• Proven experience in business development within the transport or logistics industry.
• Strong knowledge of transportation market trends and industry regulations.
• Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain client relationships.
• Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
• Willingness to travel as required.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Strategic Thinking
• Sales and Negotiation
• Product and Service Knowledge
• Communication
• Relationship Building
• Financial Acumen
• Problem-Solving
careerSingle.title: Business Development Executive

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Be the primary point of contact for the Customers and internal FLS offices.
• Actively build strong relationships with customers and gain knowledge of their business
needs.
• Ensure smooth execution of the end-to-end process, by working closely with the customer
and internal stakeholders.
• Proactively track shipments and notify customers of changes/deviations from the plan,
post discussion with sales owner, communicate solutions or mitigating plans for the
shipment.
• Own of all customer issues and engage relevant stakeholders as needed.
• Manage / improve day to day process interaction with customers by leveraging detailed
customer knowledge.
• Monitor booking trends and follow up with customers to maximize volume performance
and superior service delivery.
• Be fully responsible for customer satisfaction.
• Ensure timely and accurate submission of all relevant documents.
• Issue import, export documentation and payment receipt.
• Ensure collection of all outstanding debts before release shipment.
• Actively drive continuous improvement opportunities both in relation to customers and
internal / external stakeholder.
• Identify, measure, and maintain key performance indicators.
• Perform other duties as assigned by Manager.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
We are looking for an experienced Customer Service Executive who will be expected to proactively
manage customer experience through monitoring and managing of the end-to-end transportation
process. This individual should ensure that execution is done in compliance with company’s
standards so that cargo is delivered as promised to the customer. Customers will be kept informed
throughout the process and be updated should there be any change/deviation. Lastly, he/she will
continue to develop existing relationships with the customers and further understanding their
business needs for future collaboration.
careerSingle.networkInteraction:
INTERNAL
• Sales
• Warehouse

EXTERNAL
• Business partners
• Customers
• Vendors
careerSingle.qualification:
• Knowledge in international logistics and freight forwarding
(ocean/air & import/export. Good to have OOG knowledge and experience)
• Minimum 3 years of experience in Customer Service roles in Logistics industry
• Basic English skill (both written and spoken).
• Basic and/or intermediate Microsoft Office suite skill
(Excel, Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint)
• Service oriented, organized, and able to work under pressure.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Passionate and motivated person
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Communication skills
• Service orientation
• Operational excellence
• Analytical skills and multi-tasking
• Attentive to details
• Teamwork
careerSingle.title: Customer Service Executive

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve revenue targets and drive business
growth.
• Analyze market trends, competitive landscapes, and customer feedback to identify
opportunities and challenges.
• Monitor and report on sales performance metrics, including pipeline activity, conversion
rates, and revenue forecasts.
• Identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions to optimize sales
effectiveness and efficiency.
• Conduct on-site visits to potential clients to understand their logistics needs and present
appropriate solutions.
• Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers within client
organizations.
• Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms to secure new business and maximize profitability.
• Prospect and identify potential clients within the South Region through cold calling,
networking, and industry research.
• Develop and implement strategies to penetrate new markets and verticals.
• Continuously expand the company’s customer base by acquiring new accounts and
partnerships.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Business Development Manager is responsible for driving sales growth within the logistics sector in
the South Region. This role entails proactive field sales efforts, hunting for new business
opportunities, and developing and executing effective sales strategies to meet and exceed revenue
targets.
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in business administration, sales, marketing, or a related field.
• Proven track record of success in field sales and business development within the logistics
industry for at least 5 years.
• Strong understanding of logistics and supply chain processes, including transportation,
warehousing, and distribution.
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
• Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.
• Strategic thinker with the ability to develop and execute effective sales strategies.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, logistics software, and technology tools.
• Willingness to travel within the South Region as needed.
• Based in Chennai, Coimbatore, and Tuticorin.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Communication skills
• Presentation Skills
• Sales & Business Development
• Strategic Thinking
• Customer Focus
• Adaptability and Flexibility
careerSingle.title: Business Development Manager – South Region

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Develop and implement strategic sales plans to achieve company goals and objectives in
the South region of India.
• Identify and target potential customers through proactive prospecting, networking, and
cold calling activities.
• Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients to understand
their needs and provide tailored solutions.
• Manage the sales pipeline effectively, from lead generation to closure, ensuring timely
follow-ups and accurate forecasting.
• Conduct market research and analysis to identify opportunities, market trends, and
competitor activities, and adjust strategies accordingly.
• Develop a deep understanding of our products and services to effectively communicate
their value proposition to clients.
• Negotiate contracts and terms with clients, ensuring win-win outcomes and close deals to
meet sales targets.
• Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and market insights,
and provide regular reports to the management team.
• Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in the business
development and sales domain, and apply this knowledge to enhance performance.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Business Development Executive role in the South region of India is to drive sales growth and
expand the company’s market presence through proactive prospecting, relationship-building, and
strategic sales initiatives. This role plays a pivotal part in identifying and capitalizing on business
opportunities, acquiring new customers, and nurturing existing client relationships to achieve
revenue targets and business objectives.
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, or a related field.
• Proven track record of success in sales, with at least 3-5 years of experience in a business
development or sales role, preferably in the South region of India.
• Strong networking and relationship-building skills, with the ability to influence and
persuade stakeholders at all levels.
• Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, both verbal and written.
• Strategic thinking and analytical abilities, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
• Self-motivated and result-oriented, with a drive to exceed targets and deliver exceptional
customer experiences.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, logistics software, and technology tools.
• Willingness to travel within the South Region as needed.
• Based in Chennai, Coimbatore, and Tuticorin.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Communication skills
• Analytical skills
• Problem Solving
• Operational excellence
• Teamwork
careerSingle.title: Business Development Executive – South Region

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Develop and implement strategic plans to optimize logistics operations, improve efficiency,
and meet business objectives. Align logistics strategies with overall company goals and
objectives.
• Lead and empower a team to achieve operational objectives, providing guidance and
support as necessary.
• Oversee day-to-day logistics operations including transportation, warehousing, inventory
management, and order fulfillment. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track
operational performance and identify areas for improvement.
• Manage relationships with logistics service providers, carriers, and suppliers. Negotiate
contracts, rates, and service agreements to ensure cost-effective and reliable transportation
and logistics services.
• Stay informed about industry developments and trends, incorporating best practices to
drive continuous improvement.
• Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards, mitigating risks to the business.
• Develop and manage logistics budgets, forecast expenses, and identify opportunities for
cost savings and efficiency improvements. Implement measures to control transportation,
storage, and inventory costs.
• Collaborate with business development to ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment and
delivery. Maintain high levels of customer satisfaction by meeting or exceeding service level
agreements (SLAs) and delivery expectations.
• Prepare regular reports and analyses on logistics performance, operational metrics, and key
trends. Provide insights and recommendations to senior management for informed
decision-making and strategic planning.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
General Manager of Logistics responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of logistics
operations in the North and South Areas. Leading a team, you will ensure efficient and cost-effective
transportation, warehousing, and distribution of goods while upholding high standards of quality
and customer satisfaction. To build and maintain close relationships with customers, suppliers, and
other stakeholders, you must stay abreast of industry developments and trends to drive operational
excellence.
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a
related field.
• Proven experience 10 years in logistics management, preferably in a senior leadership role.
• Strong leadership and managerial skills with the ability to motivate and inspire teams.
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
• Sound knowledge of logistics operations, transportation modes, and supply chain processes.
• Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make data-driven
decisions.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, logistics software, and technology tools.
• Familiarity with relevant regulations and compliance requirements.
• Results-oriented with a focus on achieving operational excellence and cost efficiency.
• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, managing multiple
priorities simultaneously.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Leadership
• Strategic Planning
• Operations Management
• Communication
• Customer Focus
• Team Development
careerSingle.title: General Manager - Logistics

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Develop and execute the logistics strategy for India in alignment with the overall company
objectives. Provide strategic direction and leadership to the logistics team to ensure the
achievement of business goals.
• Oversee the day-to-day logistics operations, including transportation, warehousing,
inventory management, and distribution across the North and South regions of India.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and implement continuous improvement
initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.
• Lead, mentor, and motivate the logistics team to foster a culture of high performance,
collaboration, and innovation. Provide guidance and support to develop talent within the
team and ensure adequate staffing levels to meet business requirements.
• Manage relationships with logistics service providers, carriers, and vendors to negotiate
contracts, optimize service levels, and drive cost savings. Monitor vendor performance and
address any issues or discrepancies in a timely manner.
• Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations, standards, and policies governing logistics
operations in India. Identify and mitigate potential risks to the business related to
transportation, warehousing, and distribution activities.
• Develop and manage the logistics budget for India, including forecasting, expense tracking,
and variance analysis. Identify opportunities to reduce costs and improve profitability while
maintaining service quality.
• Drive a culture of continuous improvement within the logistics organization by
implementing best practices, leveraging technology solutions, and fostering innovation.
Lead or participate in projects aimed at streamlining processes, reducing waste, and
enhancing productivity.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
General Manager India plays a pivotal role in overseeing our logistics operations across the North
and South regions of India. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure the efficient and effective
management of our supply chain activities, optimizing processes and resources to meet
organizational goals and customer expectations. Building and maintaining close relationships with
customers, suppliers, and other stakeholders will be crucial to your success in this role.
Additionally, staying abreast of industry developments and trends will enable you to drive
operational excellence and identify opportunities for continuous improvement. Overall, you will
lead a team dedicated to delivering high-quality logistics solutions while driving growth and
profitability in the Indian market.
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in logistics, supply chain management, business administration, or a
related field.
• Proven experience 10 years in logistics management, with a successful track record in a
leadership role.
• Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and
motivate teams.
• Strategic thinking ability with a focus on driving results and achieving business objectives.
• Sound understanding of logistics operations, supply chain principles, and industry best
practices.
• Proficiency in budgeting, financial analysis, and contract negotiation.
• Knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance standards applicable to logistics
operations in India.
• Analytical mindset with the ability to analyze data, identify opportunities, and make
informed decisions.
• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Leadership
• Strategic Thinking
• Operational Excellence
• Financial Management
• Customer Relationship Management
• Communication Skills
careerSingle.title: General Manager India

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve revenue targets and drive business
growth.
• Analyze market trends, competitive landscapes, and customer feedback to identify
opportunities and challenges.
• Monitor and report on sales performance metrics, including pipeline activity, conversion
rates, and revenue forecasts.
• Identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions to optimize sales
effectiveness and efficiency.
• Conduct on-site visits to potential clients to understand their logistics needs and present

• Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers within client
organizations.
• Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms to secure new business and maximize profitability.
• Prospect and identify potential clients within the North Region through cold calling,
networking, and industry research.
• Develop and implement strategies to penetrate new markets and verticals.
• Continuously expand the company’s customer base by acquiring new accounts and

careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Business Development Manager is responsible for driving sales growth within the logistics sector in
the North Region. This role entails proactive field sales efforts, hunting for new business
opportunities, and developing and executing effective sales strategies to meet and exceed revenue
targets.
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in business administration, sales, marketing, or a related field.
• Proven track record of success in field sales and business development within the logistics

• Strong understanding of logistics and supply chain processes, including transportation,

• Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.

careerSingle.title: Business Development Manager – North Region

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Conduct market research to identify potential clients, market trends, and competitive
offerings.
• Analyze market conditions and customer needs to develop targeted strategies for business
development.
• Identify and approach potential clients in need of warehousing services.
• Create and execute sales and marketing plans to achieve revenue targets.
• Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients.
• Present the company’s warehousing solutions and value proposition to clients.
• Develop and implement a business development strategy that aligns with company goals
and objectives.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful service delivery.
• Prepare detailed proposals, quotes, and contracts for potential clients.
• Negotiate terms and pricing with clients to secure contracts.
• Set and achieve sales targets and revenue goals.
• Track and report on sales performance regularly.
• Identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling services.
• Gather customer feedback to continuously improve services and client satisfaction.
• Address and resolve client concerns and issues in a timely manner.
• Ensure all contracts and agreements are compliant with legal and company standards.
• Maintain accurate records of sales activities and contracts.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Business Development Manager – Warehousing, you will be responsible for identifying and
acquiring new business opportunities in the warehousing sector. You will play a key role in
expanding the company’s warehousing services and ensuring revenue growth. This position
requires strong market knowledge, excellent communication skills, and a strategic approach to
business development.
careerSingle.networkInteraction:
INTERNAL
• Sales
• Warehouse Operations
• Finance & Accounting

EXTERNAL
• Customers
• Vendors

careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
• Proven experience in business development, sales, or account management, preferably in
the warehousing or logistics industry at least 3 years.
• Strong understanding of warehousing operations and logistics processes.
• Able to calculate costs and prepare proposals for clients.
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Willingness to travel as required for client meetings and industry events.
• Good in English communication both spoken and written.

• Solution-Oriented Approach

careerSingle.title: Business Development Manager- Warehousing

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Customer contact for company Introduction and services.
• Continue to maintain and grow an active pipeline of forecasted sales monthly and
quarterly quotaobjectives.
• Support sales activity both internal & external like contact suppliers, calculation price,
createquotation, invoice etc.
• To coordinate and support managers and handling documents and communicating with
relevant parties to support customer’s requirement.
• Prepare document for Sales to indicate price for Quotation.
• Assist Sales Team to support overall sales activities and documentation.
• Maintain close relationship and coordination with customers.
• Support for developing new business with the management.
• Create / support report and others related jobs up on request.
• Assist on other duties assigned by management.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Commercial Executive in a warehousing context typically involves managing and overseeing various
commercial aspects of a warehouse operation. This role plays a crucial part in ensuring the efficient
and cost-effective functioning of the warehouse. Here are some key responsibilities and purposes
of a Commercial Executive in warehousing.
careerSingle.networkInteraction:
INTERNAL
• Sales
• Warehouse Operations
• Finance & Accounting

EXTERNAL
• Customers
• Vendors
• Partners
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
• Proven experience in business development, sales, or account management, preferably in
the warehousing or logistics industry at least 1-2 years.
• Strong understanding of warehousing operations and logistics processes.
• Able to calculate costs and prepare proposals for clients.
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Willingness to travel as required for client meetings and industry events.
• Good in English communication both spoken and written.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Warehouse Operations Knowledge
• Sales and Negotiation Skills
• Client Relationship Management
• Solution-Oriented Approach
• Presentation Skills
• Time Management
• Problem-Solving
careerSingle.title: Commercial Executive

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• To service and maintain machinery and equipment commonly used in a modern warehouse
operation such as:
– Electrical installation (light fixtures, electric motors, electric forklifts, electric roller
shutters, etc.)
– Firefighting equipment (pumps, valves, pipes, sprinklers, etc.)
– Machinery and systems providing added value (powder repacking line, liquid mixing
plant, stretch-foil wrapping machines, overhead cranes, etc.) and others.
• Assist during the installation, commissioning, and operation of the above equipment jointly
with the principal manufacturer and/or our in-house team.
• Conduct electrical installations.
• Always ensure customer and supplier satisfaction.
• Service and maintain the assigned systems in a way that minimizes downtime and
maintenance costs, while increasing the economic benefit for FLS and enhancing the
reputation of the product and supplier.
• Prepare, present, and discuss service and maintenance plans, as well as accompanying
quotations, for customers.
• Maintain a keen interest and profound understanding of new technologies, industries, and
the opportunities and challenges they bring.
• Be approachable and open to concerns from customers, suppliers, and colleagues always.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Service Technician for machinery encompasses a wide range of responsibilities related to the
installation, maintenance, repair, and optimization of various types of machinery and equipment
commonly used in modern warehouse operations.
careerSingle.networkInteraction:
INTERNAL
• Service & Maintenance
• Warehouse Operations

EXTERNAL
• Vendors
• Customers/Partners
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or other related fields.
• Minimum of 10 years of field service experience in installation, commissioning, start-up,
operation, and service & maintenance.
• Excellent command of written and spoken Thai and English.
• Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint).
• Experience with online connection to the OEM’s after-sales service department via modem.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
• Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
• Location for work: Maptaphut, Rayong – FSCC
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Business Awareness and Acumen
• Excellent Self-Awareness
• Leadership Skills
• Communication Skills
• Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills
careerSingle.title: Service Technician

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Responsible for the overall management of all strategic and operational marketing/ sales
as well as Customer Relationship activities.
• Provide market feedback to the company leadership regarding competitive offerings,
prospect needs and generate product development ideas.
• Take ownership of the management of the sales functions of the business.
• Drive increased revenue and profit to achieve the Company’s ambitious growth.
• Working to stringent targets, to adopt a professional and knowledgeable approach to each
new business call.
• Develop a pipeline of qualified prospects for targeted solicitation, understand their
business and solutions requirements, and engage in a consultative sales process (business
to business).
• Planning and coordinating the implementation of business plans and the penetration of
new markets.
• Maintain agent’s relationships in accordance with company policy.
• Actively responsible for P&L and Strategic planning respectively.
• Actively responsible for P&L and Strategic planning respectively.
• Monitor progress of claims and customer Satisfaction. Lead to fix all issues and increase
satisfaction level to the customer.
• Perform guidelines issued together GM FLS Logistics & Director FLS Logistics & GM FLS
Thailand & Finance.
• Monitor and develop the profitability and efficiency of processes within the assigned
customer portfolio.
• Cooperation with stake holding Departments and other FLS offices & countries.
• Provide high customer service levels, especially for key accounts.
• Responsible for development of existing and implementation of new products and traffic
lane.
• Responsible for costs and revenues of the assigned Customer portfolio.
• Comply with FLS cooperate Structure, Values, and Integrity.
• Responsible to comply with all relevant laws, regulations and Company policies.
• Other duties as assigned by management.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Business Development Executive is responsible for initiate and develop business opportunities
with new and existing customers. This role will develop and manage their individual portfolio and
work in a collaborative team environment. This role will also be responsible for prospecting,
reaching out to referrals, and business to business selling to generate inside and outside
transactional sales.
careerSingle.networkInteraction:
INTERNAL
• Sales
• Operations
• Finance & Accounting

EXTERNAL
• Customers
• Vendors
• Partners
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree or master’s degree in Business, Logistics, or related field.
• Posses knowledge in logistics industry at least 3 years’ experience in Business
Development Roles.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office (MS Excel, Word, Power Point and Outlook).
• Good Command of English with smooth communicate both side and overseas.
• Demonstrating history of commercial performance concentrated in freight forwarding,
logistics, transportation, and supply chain services, including cargo management.
• Have managerial skills in team, organizational and multitasking abilities.
• Ability to perform financial calculations, create and manage budgets.
• Solid territory management and time management skills. Motivated, goal oriented,
persistent and a skilled negotiator, with a high level of initiative and tenacity.
• Ability to conduct effective presentations and interviews with clients to develop
potential business opportunities and maintain ongoing relationships.
• Ethical with sound business judgment, using logic and reasoning to seek alternative
solutions and approaches to problems.
• Service minded, enthusiastic with strong problem-solving skills.
• Customer focused attitude and a friendly personality
• Must clearly demonstrate ability and willingness to articulate FLS’s work ethics and
values while at work and out of work, as a living testimony of the organization’s
commitment to sustainable community transformational development.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Communication skills.
• Analytical skills.
• Problem Solving skills.
• Operational excellence.
• Teamwork.
• Service orientation.
• Managerial Skills.
careerSingle.title: Business Development Executive - Logistics

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Maintain and update the general ledger, recording financial transactions accurately.
• Reconcile accounts and ensure the accuracy of financial statements.
• Prepare and file various tax returns, including income tax, sales tax, and other regulatory
filings.
• Review tax codes and classifications to ensure compliance with local, state, and federal
regulations.
• Collaborate with external auditors and tax consultants during audits and tax reviews.
• Analyze financial data to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for process
improvement.
• Provide support in month-end and year-end closing activities.
• Assist in the preparation of financial reports and presentations for management.
• Stay updated with changes in tax laws, regulations, and accounting standards.
• Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as finance, legal, and operations, to ensure
alignment on financial matters.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Tax and General Ledger Accountant is responsible for managing financial records, maintaining the
general ledger, and ensuring accurate and timely tax compliance. This role involves reconciling
financial transactions, preparing tax documents, and collaborating with internal teams to support
the company’s financial operations.
careerSingle.networkInteraction:
INTERNAL
• All Departments

EXTERNAL
• Customers
• Vendors
• Partners
• Banks
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
• Professional certification such as CPD (Continuing Professional Development) preferred.
• Proven experience in tax accounting and general ledger management.
• Strong understanding of tax regulations and compliance requirements.
• Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
• Attention to detail and accuracy in financial data management.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
• Analytical mindset and problem-solving abilities.
• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Accounting Expertise
• Tax Compliance
• Financial Analysis
• Software Proficiency
• Time Management
• Integrity
• Teamwork
careerSingle.title: Tax & GL Accountant

careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Develop and manage the logistics process from start to finish.
• Monitor and track inventory and stock levels to ensure optimal resource allocations.
• Coordinate with other departments (e.g., sales, finance) to ensure proper execution of
orders.
• Negotiate contracts and agreements with suppliers and vendors.
• Manage shipping documents, customs procedures, transport, and delivery of goods in
accordance with company policies and ensure compliance with safety regulations and
quality standards.
• Analyze data to identify areas for process optimization and cost savings.
• Respond to customer inquiries and complaints in a timely manner.
• Ensure compliance with government regulations and industry standards.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in logistics technology.
careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Logistics Executive is responsible for managing and coordinating the flow of goods and services from
suppliers to customers. They are also responsible for monitoring and controlling all logistics-related
activities within the organization, including purchasing, inventory management, distribution, and
customer service. The Logistics Executive ensures that optimal logistics solutions are implemented
to maximize efficiency, minimize costs, and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
careerSingle.networkInteraction:
INTERNAL
• Merchandising
• Sales

EXTERNAL
• Customers
• Suppliers
• Government agencies
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as logistics, supply chain management, or business
• At least 1-2 years of experience in logistics, with a proven track record of success in
logistics control.
• Strong knowledge of logistics and supply chain management principles and best practices.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
• Strong project management and organizational skills.
Certified Professional at any level in Logistics or Supply Management is a plus.
careerSingle.requiredSkills:
• Communication
• Coordination
• Planning
• Problem-solving
• Time management
• Technological proficiency
careerSingle.title: Logistics Executive

careersHero.heroText: We empower all employees to deliver unique solutions.

joinUs.title: Join us
joinUs.content:
Whether you have long-standing experience or are simply taking your first steps, FLS can offer you many different opportunities to develop your career path on an international scale and take on new responsibilities with an entrepreneurial spirit.

So if you like a challenge and share our passion and values, feel free to send your CV to hr@fls-group.com and let us explore how we can bring you and FLS to the next level, together.

careerSpotlight.spotlightContent: We put a spotlight on our greatest assets: our people.

futureThinkers.content: Revealing the thinking, inspiration and vision of our leaders.

spotlight.spotlightRole: Logistics Manager at FLS Solutions Thailand
spotlight.quote: “Thip is an absolute pillar of our organisation. Her calm and methodical approach to any task at hand keeps our backs free, because we know she is taking care of things and we can always rely on her support. She is just great to work with and is well liked by everyone in the team.”

"Khun Som-O is a key player in the founding team of FLS Warehousing. She brings a smile to everyone’s face. A bit 'tingtong' (crazy, in Thai) but also a professional lady who goes the extra mile for our customers."

spotlight.spotlightRole: Overseas Delegate for FLS in India
spotlight.quote: "Nataraj’s bravery truly impresses me. He joined FLS during the worst period of the Covid-19 pandemic as our Overseas Delegate in India - basically, as a “one-man-show”. Despite the unpredictable economy, he embraced the challenge from day one and his pro-activeness and persistence quickly brought us some excellent business results. I am proud of what he has achieved and very happy to have him on our team."

"Trung's close relationships with local vendors, authorities and fabricators along with his technical and nautical background makes him invaluable. Thanks to him we minimize the risk of cargo mishandling and damages and control the daily operational costs on the ground. On top of that, he's a really great guy."

flsMoments.content: We constantly support the development of our team through training and team-building activities.
